_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Sheetz Distribution Center is located in Claysburg, PA and is a newly constructed cold storage and distribution center.  As part of the Center?s operations, in mid-August 2001 the Center will bring on-line it?s closed loop refrigeration system using Anhydrous Ammonia as a heat removal media.
This type of process is extremely efficient and is commonly used.   Anhydrous Grade Ammonia serves as the most economically abundant and efficient heat transfer medium for industry refrigeration and heat reduction processes.  

As a result of a recognized highly toxic chemical that will be used at the Sheetz Distribution Center and in accordance with EPA?s Risk Management Program, 40 CFR, Section 68 requirements.  The Center has developed and implemented prevention program # 3.  Additionally the Center has also in place a Process Safety Management program as required by OSHA Standard 1910.119.  

The facility modeled two off site consequence analyses.  The first was a worst-case scenario that consisted of a full release of Anhydrous Ammonia stored within a storage tank containing 8960 lbs. With and evaporation rate of 896 lbs. per minute with a toxic endpoint of 3.2 miles.  Within the 3.2 radius of the facility there is an estimated residence population of 3900, commercial industry, and two schools. There are no hospitals, prisons/correction facilities or environmental receptors.

The second analysis was an alternative release scenario that consisted of a rupture disk/relief valve failure.  This scenario released 186 lbs. of ammonia with an endpoint radius of  .10 miles.  Within the .10 mile radius of the facility there is an estimate population of 12 residences only. There are no other commercial industries, schools, hospitals, recreation areas, prisons/correctional facilities, or environmental receptors.

The Sheetz Distribution Center is a newly constructed facility and will become operational in mid-August 2001 and therefore has no history of ammonia related accidents or

releases.

The facility has implemented strict preventive maintenance procedures and an Emergency Response Plan (ERP).  Release of ammonia is specially covered in the Emergency Action Plan and contains all required actions in the event of release of ammonia. As part of the facility's accidental release prevention, training is conducted for employees and new hires.  Accidental release prevention, training and awareness is reinforced annually and as the operations at the Center dictates.  Employees have received training in Hazardous Communication, Emergency Response, Spill Prevention, safe operations, maintenance, and emergency actions.  The Sheetz Distribution Center has specific operational and emergency procedures in place for delivery and handling of ammonia.
